tidyassessments 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Using tidymodels to make automated assessments

    Extinction risk predictors for Myrcia species.

    myrcia_predictors.Rd

    A dataset containing predictors to use in automated conservation methods for species of the genus Myrcia. These predictors were prepared for the paper Evidence-based guidelines for automated assessments of plant species, and described in detail there. The dataset contains a mixture of assessed and unassessed species. Assessments were compiled from the IUCN Red List v.2021-3 and predictors were calculated across observed localities for each species as downloaded from GBIF.

    myrcia_predictors

    Format

    A data frame with 666 rows and 18 variables:

    wcvp_id

    a unique identifier for the species, from WCVP

    ,
    eoo

    Extent of occurrence (EOO), in km^2

    ,
    human_footprint

    a measure of the impact of human activities, in 2009

    ,
    human_population

    human population density in 2020, in persons/km^2

    ,
    forest_loss

    proportion of a species observed localities that underwent forest loss between 2000-2019

    ,
    annual_temperature

    mean average temperature, in degrees-C

    ,
    precipitation_driest

    precipitation in the driest quarter, in mm

    ,
    elevation

    elevation, in m

    ,
    conr_eoo

    EOO, as calculated by ConR, in km^2

    ,
    conr_aoo

    Area of occupancy (AOO), as calculated by ConR, in km^2

    ,
    conr_locs

    Number of locations estimated by ConR

    ,
    conr_obs

    Number of unique observations calculated by ConR

    ,
    n_specimens

    Total number of observations

    ,
    centroid_latitude

    Latitude of range centroid, in decimal-degrees

    ,
    name

    species name, as listed in WCVP

    ,
    category

    IUCN Red List category, if assessed

    ,
    genus

    genus of species, as listed in WCVP

    ,
    section

    section of species, as detailed in Lucas et al. (2019)

    Source

    https://doi.org/10.32942/osf.io/zxq6s
